channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Russia is behind fake video of ballots being destroyed, U.S. officials say
item.description: Federal intelligence officials and the FBI say Russia is behind the video, which has spread widely on social media, including Elon Musk’s X.
item.content:encoded:
Federal intelligence officials and the FBI say Russia is behind the video, which has spread widely on social media, including Elon Musk’s X.

(Image credit: Hannah Beier/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Shannon Bond

item.title: Israel's military is conducting retaliatory airstrikes against Iran
item.description: The Israeli military has confirmed it is conducting airstrikes on "military targets in Iran," as Tehran is rocked by a series of late night explosions.
item.content:encoded:
The Israeli military has confirmed it is conducting airstrikes on "military targets in Iran," as Tehran is rocked by a series of late night explosions.

(Image credit: Majdi Mohammed)
item.dc:creator: James Hider

item.title: Army releases report about Trump campaign incident at Arlington National Cemetery
item.description: The heavily redacted report focuses on an August altercation at Arlington National Cemetery involving two campaign staffers for former President Donald Trump and a cemetery employee.
item.content:encoded:
The heavily redacted report focuses on an August altercation at Arlington National Cemetery involving two campaign staffers for former President Donald Trump and a cemetery employee.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Tom Bowman

item.title: Appeals court sides with GOP on Miss. law that provides grace period for mail ballots
item.description: A conservative appeals court sided with Republicans in ruling against a Mississippi law that allows election officials to count mail ballots that are postmarked by Election Day but arrive after it.
item.content:encoded:
A conservative appeals court sided with Republicans in ruling against a Mississippi law that allows election officials to count mail ballots that are postmarked by Election Day but arrive after it.

(Image credit: Rogelio V. Solis)
item.dc:creator: Ashley Lopez

item.title: The Grateful Dead bassist Phil Lesh dies at 84
item.description: Lesh, an original member of America's preeminent jam band, died Friday morning.
item.content:encoded:
Lesh, an original member of America's preeminent jam band, died Friday morning.

(Image credit: Michael Buckner)
item.dc:creator: Isabella Gomez Sarmiento

item.title: Support from rural Democrats will be crucial for Harris to win this swing state
item.description: North Carolina has more rural voters than any other 2024 presidential swing state, and canvassing groups are working to turn out voters in one purple county as early voting continues in the state.
item.content:encoded: North Carolina has more rural voters than any other 2024 presidential swing state, and canvassing groups are working to turn out voters in one purple county as early voting continues in the state.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: An Alleged Assassination Attempt By an Indian Spy on U.S. Soil
item.description: The U.S. Justice Department says it has foiled at least four assassination attempts tied to foreign powers in recent years. They're part of a trend of governments attempting to silence their critics overseas. We hear from the target of one of those assassination plots, which was allegedly orchestrated by an Indian intelligence official.
item.content:encoded: The U.S. Justice Department says it has foiled at least four assassination attempts tied to foreign powers in recent years. They're part of a trend of governments attempting to silence their critics overseas. We hear from the target of one of those assassination plots, which was allegedly orchestrated by an Indian intelligence official.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: McDonald's E. coli outbreak grows, with 75 people sickened in 13 states
item.description: The CDC said on Friday that dozens more people have been reported sick with E. coli linked to McDonald's Quarter Pounder.
item.content:encoded:
The CDC said on Friday that dozens more people have been reported sick with E. coli linked to McDonald's Quarter Pounder.

(Image credit: Michael M. Santiago)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Pennsylvania county halts hundreds of potentially fraudulent voter registration forms
item.description: Officials in Lancaster County in the swing state of Pennsylvania say they identified hundreds of potentially fraudulent voter registration applications.
item.content:encoded:
Officials in Lancaster County in the swing state of Pennsylvania say they identified hundreds of potentially fraudulent voter registration applications.

(Image credit: Branden Eastwood)
item.dc:creator: NPR Washington Desk

item.title: Grammy-winning crooner Jack Jones, known for singing 'The Love Boat' theme, dies at 86
item.description: Jones, who began his singing career in the 1950s and was a frequent guest on the popular romantic comedy TV show, died after a battle with leukemia.
item.content:encoded:
Jones, who began his singing career in the 1950s and was a frequent guest on the popular romantic comedy TV show, died after a battle with leukemia.

(Image credit: Casey Rodgers)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
